result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Martanya Marques Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant has paid $4385.00 to Sprint. Court ordered restitution payable to Sprint in the amount of $18500.00 converted FORTHWITH to a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept.
Pursuant to agreement, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Restitution only case. Defense provides update to the court. Case adjourned for Review Hearing in branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for June 17, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has paid approximately THREE THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($3,500.00) towards a 'good faith effort' of SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($7,500.00).   Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  All parties are advised effective January 7, 2019 case will be reassigned to Honorable Judge Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, in Room 113 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for March 18, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has continued to make payments towards the SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLAR ($7,500.00) 'good faith' restitution amount.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for December 17, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas for Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant has tendered a further TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($200.00) in restitution.  Defendant has paid a total of THREE THOUSAND TWO HUNDRED FIFTEEN DOLLARS ($3,215.00).  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 10, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant tendered a further THREE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($300.00) towards restitution.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for June 11, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has tendered a total of TWO THOUSAND THREE HUNDRED FIFTEEN DOLLARS ($2,315.00) towards Restitution.  Court ordered matter to be Staffed regarding the 'good faith effort',  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Robert Hampton III for Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that Defendant is working towards Restitution.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.

  Review hearing scheduled for October 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant is paying Restitution.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for July 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Matter is RESCHEDULED to 04-17-2017 at 08:30 am for Review.  sdg
Matter is RESCHEDULED to 02-13-2017 at 08:30 am for Review.  sdg
(2).  Proof of payment.  Filed, sdg.
(1).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has tendered proof of a TWO HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLAR ($250.00) payment rowards Restitution.  Defense advised that Defendant has been escalating his payments now that he is employed.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that he is doing his best to comply with the Restitution aspect of the DPA.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
By Agreement of the Parties,  matter is ADJOURNED to 09-26-2016 at 08:30 am for final Review.  sdg
Court is DOWN the morning of 08-23-2016.  Matter is RESCHEDULED to 08-29-2016 at 08:30 am for Review.  sdg

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defendant has paid a total of ONE HUNDRED AND TEN DOLLARS ($110.00) towards Restitution as of this hearing.  The total amount of Restitution to reflect a 'good faith effort' will be SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($7,500.00).  Defense advised that Defendant has attained new employment and will be able to begin higher WEEKLY payments.  Court went off the Record to hold Sidebar.  Hearing continued on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for August 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude who appeared by phone.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered case adjourned for a review hearing.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  Defense advised that the office of the OSPD is retaining Restitution payments and will mail them out to the victim when it becomes cost-effective.  Defense advised that Defendant will be making payments every Friday.  Defendant has an upcoming job interview and will be able to contribute more towards Restitution at that point.  State advised that the Defendant is not at the point in the DPA that he should be.  Defense advised that for each of the past TWO (2) WEEKS Defendant HAS made Restitution payments even though he was not employed.  Defense advised that Defendant will be beginning employment on 06-13-2016.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler for Michael Jude.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State advised that Defendant provided proof TODAY (05-16-2016) of a further TWENTY-FIVE DOLLARS ($25.00).  Based upon Defendant's non-payment of Restitution,  the victim no longer wishes the Defendant to participate in the DPA.  State advsised that Defendant will need to pay a minimum amount per week.  State moved to impose a jail sanction in order to impress upon the Defendant the urgency of his situation.  Defense advised that Defendant has not been able to accurately portray his personal feelings regarding this matter.  Defense advised that Defendant felt uncomfortable giving small payments towards Restitution and therefore was not making ANY payments.  Defense advised that Defendant has met all the other terms of the DPA.  Defense moved to have any sanction set to ONE (1) DAY.   Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defendant advised that he was not making payments as he felt that making 'miniscule' payments seemed inappropriate given the amount of Restitution involved.  Court IMPOSED and STAYED a TWO (2) DAY sanction at this time.  Matter remains calendared for 05-31-2016 at 03:00 pm for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
(from) DA's Office.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Michael Jude.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Review hearing proceeded on the Record.  Court held colloquy with the Defendant.  Defense advised that Defendant tendered a TWENTY-FIVE DOLLAR ($25.00) Restitution payment TODAY.  However,  Defendant recently LOST employment.  Defendant advised that he has been attending Job Fairs.  Defendant will be attending a Job Fair on April 8th with his previous employer.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant advised that Defendant will be able to pay TWO HUNDRED DOLLARS ($200.00) today.  Defendant owes SEVEN THOUSAND FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS ($7,500.00) in restitution.  Defendant HAS completed the letter of apology.  State requested a SIXTY (60) DAY adjournment in order for Defendant to pay restitution.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
(from) Defendant to the Victim.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense requests an adjournment to complete Community Service.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg

State reports that Defendant will be entering into a DPA.  State reports that the Victim is represented in Court today.    Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  
 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement as to count 1 ONLY.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY as to BOTH counts.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction as to count 1 ONLY and ENTERED  judgment of conviction as to count 2.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  

AS TO COUNT 2 ONLY:  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served; Huber privileges. Report by 10/02/2015 by 5pm.  Failure to report will result in a straight time sentence.

Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 09-22-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Sentencing Referral Form.

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33 as to count 1 ONLY.  Review hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Adding Count 2, Theft (Value not exceeding $2,500.00). Filed, sdg.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Discussion regarding the deferred prosecution agreement offered in this case. Parties request this matter be transferred to drug treatment court for resolution. Court granted joint request and ordered this matter be transferred to Branch 3, Judge Ashley. Case adjourned to Branch 33.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for deferred prosecution hearing. Parties are prepared to proceed. Court held in chambers discussion with both parties. Court back on the record. The Court will not accept the deferred prosecution agreement as offered today and ordered an adjourned plea date be set. Signed DPA Agreement returned to ADA Cotter. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per the request for substitution against Judge Conen (post-rotation).  The newly assigned court is Judge Rothstein's Court.
against Judge Conen (post-rotation) filed by defense.  The newly assigned court is Judge Rothstein's Court.

Parties request an adjournment.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Parties are working on a proposed DPA.
Case adjourned to 07-21-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing/DPA.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Sprint stores.

Defendant Martanya Marques Washington in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 2.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
